title: Pre-Season 1 Veigar Main: Feedback for his "Remake"
body:
November, two thousand and nine. Soon to be six years ago I was ecstatic when I learned a game I'd been watching for sometime left Closed Beta and I could finally jump in. My first match I played Master Yi, I had no clue what I was doing, I fed the enemy team. Then I picked up a lovely little evil Yordle who has been my first "Main" since those dark days. Who I've played and loved this entire time. I've been around since Twisted Fate's Ultimate was once a global map reveal and slow and his gate was his E. I've seen mechanics added I've seen them removed. I've seen many wonderful items (rest in peace dfgesus) removed  for the sake of "Game Balance" or no one is using them except when the situation arises or in the rare case they use them only on certain champions. I saw the AP ratio removed on Veigar's ult and saw it changed into percent of maximum mana with a mana restoration if it dealt a killing blow which while Akali and Katarina existed it perplexed me and pigeon holed me into playing him mostly against champions like Ryze if I wanted success.

I've adapted to every single change in the meta and with the current "Highly Mobile" Meta that Yasuo, Nidalee, Katarina, Akali, Zed, Kalista and others like them have heralded in I can say one thing with extreme confidence. 1.25 seconds to deploy my only defensive maneuver against several champions who can deplete my health pool nigh instantaneously has basically told me "You are not to play or enjoy this champion ever again." I won't lie to you I picked Veigar into Katarina, I picked him into Fizz, I even picked him into Zed and I have won all of these match ups with prudent usage and application of my E and adapting my build order to the situation. I will not lie and say that I never warded the bushes next to mid lane's river bushes so I knew to position myself so as to successfully survive a gank and maybe get a kill as a sweet treat. This was simply what I learned when it came to playing my champion.

His Q is a change that sure, it allows me to last hit two minions or last hit a minion and harass but honestly if I wanted to play Ziggs or Orianna I'd play Ziggs or Orianna. Veigar when played well has very little counter play which honestly should be a reward not only for your skill but for playing a champion whose entire usefulness to a team hinges on his pre-level six laning phase which will be non-existent now that you've taken away his only defensive ability.

His passive in Season 5 is useless. I go out of mana even with mana pots and crystalline flask in laning phase. Swaine's passive pre-clarity changes was better than what I am shackled with as Veigar. You said you "Lowered his Q's cooldown" in early materials regarding his changes which was insulting to my intelligence since at max rank it's only four seconds previously where as now it's five.

I do not know whom all was in charge of this change, but I would hope with the death of an identity and the destruction of an entire champion's play style over the course of three patches, destroying a beloved champion for the few proud who actually mained him and played him well...
I hope your resignation is on your boss' desk by the end of this season. 

If I had the option I would refund Final Boss Veigar, Bad Santa Veigar, Curling Veigar, White Mage Veigar, Baron Von Veigar, Leprechaun Veigar, Superb Villain Veigar and Veigar the Gray simply because the fact I will **never** play this champion again means I wasted all of the Riot Points  I spent on the skins.

Sincerely,
 Season 4 Gold Veigar Main, Pre-Season 1 Veigar Main and an **extremely unhappy** League of Legends Player, ASC Jabberwocky (Formerly Black Eis)

EDIT: http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.winPercent&order=descend&roleSort=Middle
Champion win rates post 5.4
Veigar has the third lowest win rate, only Kassadin and Azir have lower win rates. Zilean mid beats Veigar Mid's win rate now even post 5.4.

However, when they finally came for the Veigar mains there was no one left but me." However, this isn't the case. Veigar was free pre-patch and he is still free for Talon. Talon straight up counters Veigar since if I'm inside his stun radius I can blink out with my E. If it isn't a hard climb why does every league player believe in elo hell and its "too hard" to carry in bronze and silver.

I don't believe in "Elo Hell" I believe in bad luck and bad team composition.
I'm fairly certain Talon's E does **not** circumvent the cage when it's already dropped.
I've faced Talon's in Gold or who are placed Platinum (I have friends who are platinum and diamond) and beat them as Veigar because of itemization. Rush Zhonya's and once he E's on you activate and laugh while the debuff ticks off and his enhanced damage is gone. Luckily enough Talon **has** to get ahead to do damage, prevent that and it's easy.
Ideally I'd want a level two or level three gank on him to get him behind. Most Veigars got Event Horizon second spell after Baleful. A strong jungler like (I feel dirty saying this) Lee Sin or a hard crowd control jungler like Elise at level two can guarantee a kill on a Talon who is likely playing aggressive because of confidence in the lane match up.
If I can't get that, play passively and farm under tower which **isn't** hard to do as Veigar.

It does circumvent it. I have done it multiple times. All I do is bait out cage then E on Veigar and beat his ass with my autos for the lvl 3 cheese. Its pretty easy and I have never lost a lane against a Veigar. Go try it yourself Talon was even a harder counter before his nerf. Talon beats veigar in every aspect in lane.

Tested so I can confirm Cutthroat **doesn't** trigger Veigar's Event Horizon stun.'
However, with the range on Cut Throat at level three I'm going to be hugging tower likely or if I'm not I'm going to flash you under it since you follow me mid teleport if I flash.
Amusingly, this has happened several times against Talon and even Zed when I laned against them.
I just dont push the wave and wait for kills and If I know they are smart enough to play safe I just shove the lane extremely hard and go roam. I never lose lane against Veigar lol.

It's not a matter of lack of counterplay it's a matter of refusing to itemize to counter who you're up against which is a lost and forgotten ideal that got left behind in Season 2.

Riot is moving towards skillshots and mobility. They believe there is more counter play there--you can juke Ahri, Zed, Lee, Reksai (kind of), Vi (well the q, not the ult), Graves, Thresh, Janna, Lissandra (the range on the ult makes it avoidable), and Rumble. Old Veigar was basically one of the few champions that could land land one skillshot and then basically point and click someone to death. In a sense, it's a bit like pre-nerf Ryze where the counterplay basically boiled down to staying the fck away.

I wouldn't call his E a skill shot. It's more of a short duration circular aimed from above bear trap. ;p
Now it's a short duration circular aimed giant flashing light with sirens for people to get away from you and your team.
